headline: Fergusons Curfew Lifted as National Guard Arrives
author: Matthew Dolan and Pervaiz Shallwani
description: Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon lifted the nighttime curfew as the National Guard arrived to help restore order in Ferguson after another night of clashes between police and protesters.

headline: Missouri Governor Faces Angry Crowd at Meeting
author: Ben Kesling
description: Missouri Governor Jay Nixon, other officials faced a hostile crowd Saturday in St. Louis as they announced a plan to institute a state of emergency and a curfew for Ferguson.

headline: Fergusons Divide Fueled Tensions
author:
Mark Peters
		
	and Ben Kesling
description: Racial tensions that have exploded in Ferguson, Mo., over the police shooting of Michael Brown have been decades in the making.

headline: Groups Around Country March in Solidarity With Missouri Protesters
author: Pervaiz Shallwani in New York, Sheila V Kumar in Los Angeles and Scott Calvert in Baltimore
description: Groups in cities across the country marched in solidarity Thursday with those in Ferguson, Mo., who have been protesting the killing by a police officer of an unarmed teenager, Michael Brown.

headline: Protests in Ferguson Decry Deaths of Black Teens
author: Jesse Newman
description: Hundreds of people gathered amid heavy rain and blowing winds in Ferguson, Mo., to demonstrate against the killing of Michael Brown and at least one other St. Louis-Area black teenager by white police officers in recent months.

headline: Racial Divide in Response to Missouri Shooting Poll Finds
author: Andrea Gallo
description: The shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo., last week has stirred contrasting reactions from blacks and whites nationwide, a new Pew Research Center study shows.

headline: Protesters Hit the Streets With Hands Up
author: Ben Kesling and Mark Peters
description: "Hands up, don't shoot!" has become the rallying cry for protesters in Ferguson, Mo., where unarmed 18-year-old Michael Brown was shot and killed by a police officer.

headline: Leaked Autopsy Details Struggle Before Ferguson Shooting Death
author: Ben Kesling
description: Unarmed teenager Michael Brown allegedly charged Ferguson, Mo., police officer Darren Wilson moments before he was shot dead, according to a police account in a leaked copy of an official autopsy.

headline: Small Group Gathers in St Louis to Support Officer at Center of Storm
author: Dan Frosch And Melanie Trottman
description: A day before Michael Brown was to be buried, a few dozen people gathered outside a bar near downtown to support Darren Wilson, the police officer who shot him to death more than two weeks ago setting off a heated national discourse on race.

headline: Ferguson Curfew to Continue Indefinitely
author: Josh Mitchell
description: Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon said authorities would continue to impose a curfew in Ferguson, Mo., indefinitely to contain violent protests over the death of 18-year-old Michael Brown, an unarmed black teenager shot by a police officer a week ago.

headline: Protests Planned in St Louis Ferguson
author: Ben Kesling
description: Protest organizers in the St. Louis area hoped to draw crowds this weekend from all over the country, days after the Vonderrit Myers shooting and two months since the death of Michael Brown.

headline: Police Reports Reveal Little About Ferguson Shooting
author: Ben Kesling And Pervaiz Shallwani
description: The first glimpse of police reports filed in relation to the shooting death of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo., surfaced on Friday, but shed little light on what happened.

headline: Holder Vows Thorough Probe of Shooting
author: Devlin Barrett
description: Attorney General Eric Holder sought to assure residents of Ferguson, Mo., that the U.S. Justice Department was thoroughly probing the shooting of 18-year-old Michael Brown by a police officer.

headline: Missouri Governor Announces Ferguson Commission
author: Ben Kesling
description: Missouri Governor Jay Nixon announced Tuesday the creation of a regional commission to study and recommend ways to address underlying, systemic inequality in the wake of the shooting of Michael Brown.

headline: Sharpton Links Ferguson Shooting Staten Island PoliceCustody Death
author: Michael Howard Saul
description: The Rev. Al Sharpton on Saturday said the issues surrounding the Missouri shooting of Michael Brown mirrored those in the death of a Staten Island man in police custody last month.

headline: President Obama Calls for Reflection After Missouri Teens Shooting
author: Jeffrey Sparshott
description: President Barack Obama urged "reflection and understanding" after the death of Michael Brown, the Ferguson, Mo., teenager whose death at the hands of police has sparked unrest.

headline: Ferguson Protest March Ends in Chaos
author: Matthew Dolan and Pervaiz Shallwani
description: A protest march in Ferguson, Mo., ended in chaos when police forced back marchers in a cloud of smoke.

headline: National Guard to Leave Ferguson
author: Matthew Dolan
description: Missouri's governor ordered the withdrawal of the National Guard troops that were sent to the strife-torn city of Ferguson early this week after protesters grew increasingly violent.

headline: Ferguson Reaches Turning Point Police and Protesters Say
author: Matthew Dolan And Pervaiz Shallwani
description: There are new signs the violent protests that rocked this St. Louis suburb for more than a week may be abating, law-enforcement and protest leaders say.

headline: NY Protest to Include Missouri Case
author: Mara Gay
description: A Staten Island rally for a man who died in an apparent police chokehold will include protests over the fatal shooting of an unarmed black teenager in Missouri, as civil-rights leaders begin linking the two deaths

headline: Protests Calm After Police Change Tack In Missouri
author: Mark Peters, Ben Kesling  and Devlin Barrett
description: Protests in Missouri turned peaceful overnight following four nights of violent confrontations. The calm came after Missouri Gov. Nixon put the state highway patrol in charge of security in Ferguson.

headline: Ferguson Protests Continue Across the US
author: A Wall Street Journal Roundup
description: Protests resumed across the nation Tuesday, marking the second night of demonstrations following the decision by a grand jury not to indict a Ferguson, Mo., police officer in the shooting death of a black teenager.

headline: Grand Jury Transcripts Show Widely Varying Witness Testimony
author: A Wall Street Journal Roundup
description: The transcripts of the grand jury proceedings investigating police officer Darren Wilson’s actions in the shooting death of Michael Brown reveal that witnesses’ testimony varied widely on the key details of the Aug. 9 encounter.

headline: AfricanAmericans Gain Council Seats in Ferguson
author: Ben Kesling
description: Half of the members of the City Council in Ferguson, Mo., will be African-American following the city’s first election since the shooting death of Michael Brown by a police officer.

headline: Ferguson Protests Leave Three Shot Five Arrested
author: Associated Press
description: Looting, fires and gunfire broke out in Ferguson overnight during protests in response to the death of a black man in police custody in Baltimore.

headline: Grand Jury Decision on Ferguson Shooting Sparks Fresh Unrest
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: Protests continued after a grand jury declined to indict a Ferguson police officer in the death of an unarmed black teenager. (Zuma Press)

headline: Grand Jury Decision Sparks Fresh Unrest in Ferguson
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon Tuesday said he would triple the National Guard presence in the St. Louis region in the wake of widespread violence following a grand jury decision not to indict police officer Darren Wilson in the shooting death of Michael Brown.

headline: Marching Through the Streets
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: Demonstrators across the U.S. took to the streets on Tuesday night to protest the decision of a grand jury to not indict Darren Wilson, a white police officer, for shooting unarmed black teenager Michael Brown.

headline: Police Claim Ambush After Two Officers Shot at Ferguson Protest
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: Police get ready to fire from cover after two officers were shot outside the Ferguson, Mo., police department. (Photo: Associated Press.)

headline: Police Hunt Shooter of Two Officers Ambushed at Ferguson Protest
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: MOVING IN: A tactical team searches a house after two officers were shot in front of the Ferguson, Mo., police headquarters early Thursday.

headline: Two Officers Shot Amid Ferguson Protest
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: Two police officers were shot early Thursday outside the Ferguson, Mo., police department as demonstrators gathered after the police chief resigned in the wake of a scathing Justice Department report alleging bias in the department.

headline: Two Police Officers Shot During Protests in US City of Ferguson
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: A man confronts a police officer in Ferguson, Mo., during protests outside the police department and court, where two officers were shot Thursday. (Reuters.)

headline: Ferguson Area Clergy Lead Peaceful Protest
author: Ben Kesling
description: A sunrise prayer vigil and dozens of clergy marching in the streets here Tuesday was a stark counterpoint to the destruction and looting that took place Monday night just miles away in Ferguson.

headline: Comparing the Michael Brown and Eric Garner Cases
author: Yoni Bashan
description: Legal experts compare the cases of  Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo., and Eric Garner on Staten Island.

headline: Darren Wilson Says He Feared for His Life
author: Valerie Bauerlein
description: Police officer Darren Wilson says in an interview with ABC he wouldn’t have done anything differently in the August shooting death of unarmed black teenager Michael Brown in the St. Louis suburb of Ferguson.

headline: Ferguson Court Sees New Era as State Judge Takes Over
author: Ben Kesling
description: A Missouri state-appointed judge presided over the Ferguson municipal court for the first time, inaugurating changes to a system deemed biased against minorities by the U.S. Department of Justice.

headline: Ferguson Grand Jury Still in Session
author: Ben Kesling
description: The grand jury deciding whether to indict officer Darren Wilson in the shooting death of Michael Brown is still in session, according to the county prosecutor.

headline: Missouri Declares State of Emergency
author: Ben Kesling
description: Gov. Jay Nixon declared a state of emergency for Missouri, ahead of an anticipated announcement from a grand jury in the shooting death of Michael Brown and protests expected to take place in the St. Louis area.

headline: Missouri Judge to Take Over Ferguson Cases
author: Ben Kesling
description: The Missouri Supreme Court on Monday reassigned all municipal court cases in Ferguson to a state appeals court judge, essentially taking over the city’s court system.

headline: National Guard Pares Presence in Ferguson Area
author: Ben Kesling
description: The Missouri National Guard has already begun to reduce its footprint in the St. Louis region, though troops remain in Ferguson, according to state officials.

headline: No Decision on Ferguson Officer if He Isnt Indicted
author: Ben Kesling
description: Senior officials in Ferguson, Mo., said the town hasn’t decided whether Officer Darren Wilson will return to the police force if a grand jury doesn’t indict him in the shooting death of an unarmed local teenager.

headline: Officials Gird for More Unrest in Ferguson
author: Ben Kesling
description: Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon said law-enforcement officials have been working to make sure residents will be kept safe once prosecutors announce whether a suburban St. Louis police officer will face charges for fatally shooting 18-year-old Michael Brown.

headline: Officials Lay Out Rules for Police Handling of Ferguson Protests
author: Ben Kesling
description: “Rules of conduct” released as grand jury appeared close to announcing whether to indict a white police officer for the killing of an unarmed black teenager this summer.

headline: Protesters Plan Response to Ferguson Decision
author: Ben Kesling
description: As both sides wait for a decision on whether a grand jury will indict the white Ferguson police officer who killed a black teenager in August, protesters stood in the falling snow Sunday, waiting to step off on a well-organized march.

headline: Protests Pass Quietly in Ferguson
author: Ben Kesling
description: Investigations continued Friday in the shooting of two police officers after protests lasted only a few hours the night before as rain, activist organization and police tactics defused tensions.

headline: Ferguson Grand Jury Decision Expected at 8 pm Central
author: Ben Kesling and Mark Peters
description: St. Louis County Prosecutor Robert McCulloch will announce at 8 p.m. Central Standard Time a grand jury’s decision on whether to indict white Ferguson police officer Darren Wilson in the shooting death of unarmed black teenager Michael Brown.

headline: Ferguson Grand Jury Deliberations Likely to Begin Soon
author: Ben Kesling
description: The grand jury probing the fatal shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo., heard some of its final testimony and is likely to begin deliberations soon, attorneys for Mr. Brown’s family said.

headline: Missouri Shooting Sparks Protests
author: Ben Kesling and Joe Barrett
description: The police-involved shooting death of an allegedly armed black man in a St. Louis suburb led to small protests and four arrests overnight, according to police.

headline: Ferguson Hit by Looting Arson
author: Ben Kesling, Pervaiz Shallwani and Mark Peters
description: Peaceful protests in Ferguson, Mo., gave way to looting and arson in the wake of a grand jury decision not to indict a white police officer in the summer shooting of an unarmed black teenager.

headline: Ferguson Uneasy After Violent Night
author: Ben Kesling, Pervaiz Shallwani and Mark Peters
description: More protests were planned throughout the region after a grand jury declined to indict police officer Darren Wilson in the shooting of unarmed 18-year-old Michael Brown.

headline: Ferguson Police Officer Not Charged in Black Teens Shooting
author: Ben Kesling and Mark Peters
description: A grand jury declined to indict police officer Darren Wilson in the shooting of unarmed 18-year-old Michael Brown, sparking renewed unrest in Ferguson Mo., which became a national flash point over race and justice during weeks of turmoil this summer.

headline: Ferguson Residents Help Clean Up Join in Holiday Celebrations
author: Pervaiz Shallwani
description: Ferguson area residents came out in a show of support Thursday to clean up debris, spruce up buildings and celebrate Thanksgiving after violence erupted in response to a grand jury’s decision in the fatal shooting of Michael Brown.

headline: FergusonArea School District Cancels Classes Next Week
author: Douglas Belkin
description: A school district adjacent to Ferguson, Mo., has canceled classes next week in anticipation of protests that could follow the grand jury decision in the shooting death of Michael Brown.

headline: Ferguson Protesters Aim for Bigger Movement
author: Dan Frosch, Ana Campoy  and Valerie Bauerlein
description: Many of the young people who have taken to the streets around the U.S. in Ferguson-related protests vow to turn the rallies against police brutality into a movement that will last long beyond this week.

headline: How Ferguson Became a Symbol
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: A visual chronology of events in Ferguson, Mo., from the shooting of Michael Brown by Officer Darren Wilson on Aug. 9 to the grand-jury decision on Monday.

headline: Federal Review Faults Police Response to Ferguson Protests
author: Devlin Barrett
description: Local police improperly used military tactics—including dogs, tear gas and snipers—that escalated rather than eased protests in Ferguson, Mo., last year, according to a soon-to-be-released Justice Department report.

headline: In Ferguson Art Replaces Arson
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: A week after rioters tore through Ferguson, Mo., and other communities protesting a grand jury decision not to indict a police officer who killed 18-year-old Michael Brown in August, street artists tried to recast boarded-up storefronts in the St. Louis suburb with images of peace and racial understanding.

headline: US Wont Charge Ferguson Police Officer Darren Wilson
author: Devlin Barrett
description: The Justice Department said it would not file federal civil-rights charges against the former Ferguson, Mo., police officer who fatally shot an unarmed black teen last year.

headline: Turning Ferguson Into a Federal Case Wont Be Easy
author: Devlin Barrett and Ben Kesling
description: A decision by a Missouri grand jury not to indict Darren Wilson shifts the focus to the Justice Department and whether federal civil rights charges are warranted in the shooting.

headline: Michael Browns Family Files Civil Lawsuit Against Ferguson
author: Joe Barrett
description: The family of Michael Brown filed a civil lawsuit against the city of Ferguson, Mo., over the fatal shooting of the unarmed black 18-year-old.

headline: Michael Browns Parents Announce Lawsuit
author: Associated Press
description: Lawyers for the parents of an unarmed, black, 18-year-old who was fatally shot by a white police officer in the St. Louis suburb of Ferguson, Mo., said Thursday that they would file a civil lawsuit in Michael Brown’s death.

headline: Missouri AG Seeks to Block Ferguson Grand Juror From Speaking Out
author: Ben Kesling
description: Missouri’s attorney general filed papers Monday seeking to block a grand juror’s request to speak publicly about the decision not to indict a Ferguson police officer in the shooting death of Michael Brown.

headline: Judge Issues Temporary Order on Use of Tear Gas in Ferguson Protests
author: Joe Barrett and Ben Kesling
description: A federal judge in St. Louis issued a temporary restraining order Thursday against the use of tear gas and other agents to disperse peaceful demonstrators without providing adequate warning and meeting other conditions.

headline: Protests Over Decision in Ferguson Mo Challenge NYPD
author: Mark Morales
description: Commissioner William Bratton called violence in Ferguson “very disturbing” and said he would work with protesters to avoid similar unrest when a Staten Island grand jury returns a decision in a police-involved death.

headline: Officer Not Charged in Killing
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: A grand jury declined to indict police officer Darren Wilson in the shooting of unarmed 18-year-old Michael Brown, whose death touched off weeks of civil unrest that made Ferguson, Mo., a national flashpoint over race and justice.

headline: Missouri Running Out of Emergency Funds for Ferguson
author: Matthew Dolan
description: Gov. Jay Nixon said he would call a special session of the state legislature to provide “critical” funding for the National Guard and Highway Patrol still on patrol in Ferguson.

headline: Officer in Ferguson Shooting Resigns
author: Matthew Dolan
description: Darren Wilson, the white Ferguson police officer who shot to death a black teen last summer and avoided criminal prosecution this week has resigned from the police force.

headline: Protesters Fan Out as Missouri Gov Calls For New Security Funds
author: Matthew Dolan
description: Nearly 100 locations from utility substations to sports stadiums are under watch this weekend by the Missouri National Guard and state Highway Patrol, Gov. Jay Nixon wrote in a Saturday letter to lawmakers.

headline: Protesters Swarm Mall Near Ferguson
author: Matthew Dolan and Pervaiz Shallwani
description: Several hundred protesters swarmed a mall near Ferguson, Mo., in a Black Friday protest over the lack of an indictment in the police-involved fatal shooting of 18-year-old Michael Brown.

headline: Brown Family Lawyers Criticize Prosecutor Legal Process
author: Pervaiz Shallwani
description: Attorneys for Michael Brown’s family lashed out on Tuesday at the local prosecutor and the legal process that led a grand jury not to indict officer Darren Wilson in the shooting death of the black teen.

headline: Protests Spread Across US on Black Friday
author: AUTHOR_NOT_FOUND
description: People demonstrated against the Ferguson, Mo., grand jury decision in the Michael Brown case in cities from San Francisco to New York City.

headline: St Louis Mayor Expects Mostly Peaceful Protests
author: Ben Kesling
description: The city’s mayor said he expects mostly nonviolent protests in the days after a grand jury announces whether it will indict the Ferguson police officer who shot and killed Michael Brown, but he also expects police will make arrests.

headline: Europe Sees Ferguson as Blight on US Rights Record
author: Stephen Fidler, Gregory L. White and Bertrand Benoit
description: Europe’s reaction to the rioting in the Missouri town of Ferguson reflects a common theme on the continent: that America’s human-rights record excludes its African-American minority.

headline: Protesters Turn Out in US Cities Following Decision
author: Thomas MacMillan, Alejandro Lazo and Cameron McWhirter
description: Protests broke out in a number of U.S. cities following the decision on Monday by a grand jury not to indict a Ferguson, Mo., police officer in the shooting death of a black teenager.

headline: Protests Spread in US Cities Following Decision
author: Thomas MacMillan, Alejandro Lazo and Cameron McWhirter
description: Protests broke out in a number of U.S. cities following the decision on Monday by a grand jury not to indict a Ferguson, Mo., police officer in the shooting death of a black teenager.
